Main

Class LevelLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • Main.LevelLoader

  • public class LevelLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to save game progress to a file and read saved progress.

    Course Info:

    ICS4U0 with Ms. Krasteva
    Version:
    4.0 June 10, 2019

    Total time spent writing file: 3 hours

    Instance Variables:

    names The ArrayList storing all the names of players with saved games.

    levels The ArrayList storing all the levels of players with saved games.

    maxSaves The maximum number of games that are to be saved.

    Author:
    Rohan Krishna

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LevelLoader(int max)
      This constructor creates the names and levels ArrayLists and sets the maximum number of games that can be saved.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearFile()
      This method clears the file containing the save progress.
      int getPlayerData(java.lang.String name)
      This method returns the current level of a player with a saved game.
      void saveProgress(java.lang.String name, int level)
      This method calls writeToFile() to create a new saved game.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelLoader

        public LevelLoader(int max)
        This constructor creates the names and levels ArrayLists and sets the maximum number of games that can be saved.
        Parameters:
        max - The maximum number of games that can be saved.

    • Method Detail

      • saveProgress

        public void saveProgress(java.lang.String name,
                         int level)
        This method calls writeToFile() to create a new saved game. Data is added to the file in descending order by level and alphabetical order within each level.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be added to the file.
        level - The level of the game to be saved.

        start The index of the first occurence of a level in the levels ArrayList. end The index of the last occurence of a level in the levels ArrayList.

      • clearFile

        public void clearFile()
        This method clears the file containing the save progress.

        Local Variables:

        output The PrintWriter object used to overwrite the existing file.

      • getPlayerData

        public int getPlayerData(java.lang.String name)
        This method returns the current level of a player with a saved game.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player whose data is to be loaded.
        Returns:
        The level at which the game is saved. If the player does not have a saved file, returns -1.
